meanings.definition: A feeling of discomfort in the stomach, often accompanied by nausea or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The spicy food gave me collywobbles.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't sleep due to the collywobbles in her stomach.
meanings.sent3: The thought of the upcoming test gave him collywobbles.
meanings.sent4: The roller coaster ride left her with collywobbles in her stomach.
meanings.sent5: The collywobbles before a performance are common among actors.

meanings.sent1: He collywobbles before giving a speech.
meanings.sent2: She always collywobbles before meeting new people.
meanings.sent3: The cat collywobbles when it hears thunder.
meanings.sent4: The dark forest path made him collywobbles with fear.
meanings.sent5: The collywobbles made her hesitate before taking the leap.

meanings.sent1: Eating too much ice cream can collywobbles you.
meanings.sent2: He collywobbles after eating the expired food.
meanings.sent3: The collywobbles from the food poisoning were unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The bumpy car ride collywobbles her stomach.
meanings.sent5: The collywobbles kept him up all night.
